TopicTitle: What do you run KSP on?

Articles.Content:
So, I'm coming from a thread in which there was a discussion on how desktop keyboards have spacing between the F4 and F5 keys, laptop keyboards don't. (Someone was complaining that the Alt-F5 key bind to create a named quicksave was just a button away from Alt-F4 to close KSP.) So, now I'm wondering, what type of system do you (usually) use for KSP? Is it a desktop? Laptop? All-in-one? Surface Pro? Toaster? Let us know!

I personally run KSP on a Windows install on a MacBook Pro.

Edited December 13, 2015 by Hobbes Novakoff
I use a Linux desktop, but the keyboard I use for KSP is a compact Logitech wireless one, with no spacing between groups of function keys. Which probably doesn't help answer your question.

Hmm. I must add a new question to the poll...

EDIT: nevermind. Forum gets angry at me.

Edited December 13, 2015 by Hobbes Novakoff

Laptop, same as my other games. Can't have a desktop because I travel a lot between home (France) and university (Scotland).

Windows for now. I'll get computing courses next semester so I might get interested in Linux (and I also hate W10).

Still, it's a pretty good one, and it can run my over-40-mods KSP install smoothly, as long as I don't go too much over 150 parts.
If someone manages to run KSP on a toaster, I will be proud.
